intro: Cheliusia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
